DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Operating Room Duration Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time in minutes, from beginning to end, that an individual is in the operating room during surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A room in a health care facility equipped for the performance of surgical operations and procedures._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A room in a health care facility equipped for the performance of surgical operations and procedures.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: A room in a health care facility equipped for the performance of surgical operations and procedures.
The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues._A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds._The second is the unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.:A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:The second is the unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.

A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

DataElement.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON
